sense.def: ① Pathological Condition identical with xu 虛② , depletion. Ming yi bie lu 名醫別錄 Substance Entry yi tang 飴糖：主補虛 乏，止渴，去血 , “It controls supplementation of depletion and exhaustion , stops thirst, and removes blood”.

② Illness Sign of decreased body functions and abilities. Zhu bing yuan hou lun 諸病源候論 5: 夫人渴病者，皆由 臟腑不和，經絡虛竭所為。故病雖瘥，血氣未復，仍虛乏也 , “Now, when someone has a thirst disease, this is always the result of a disharmony among depots and palaces with a depletion-exhaustion of conduits and network [vessels]. Hence the disease may have been healed, but as long as blood and qi have not recovered yet, the status is one of depletion and exhaustion ”.
Xu feng 虛風 , depletion wind [10]

① Etiological Agent. of non-seasonal climatic conditions able to cause disease in man. Ling shu 靈樞 50: 黃色薄皮弱肉者，不勝春之虛風 , “[Patients] whose skin is yellow and thin, and whose flesh is weak, are unable to overcome a spring-time depletion wind ”.
② Pathological Condition identical with man pi feng 慢脾風 , slow spleen wind. Ying tong bai wen 嬰童百問 2: 慢脾風 一名虛風 , “Another name for slow spleen wind is depletion wind ”.
